ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned some basic knowledge about German language, including grammar, vocabulary.
I learned how to understand and speak basic German.
I learned basic German vocabulary, phrases, and grammar.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was taught the best it could be
Its a quite intensive course in that we have several homework in a week, and we meet everyday, but I think its a good way for language learning.

The ability of the teachers varied between the graduate students who taught the classes. I believe that GMAN 110 classes would be more equitable if the teaching was more standardized between the sections/classes.
The course is taught all in German which makes it helpful for learning vocabulary and basic grammatical structures. However this makes learning more complicated rules more difficult.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if they would like to learn German

I would recommend this course to another student who is interested in learning German, but if you are not motivated to learn the language of passionate about the subject matter, this class might not be for you.

If the other student was already interested in taking German then I would suggest this course. If the other student was not interested in German in particular then I might suggest a different language because it was a relatively large part of my workload for the semester.
